body:
Comment 6: 
This should have been fixed for Go 1.1. The simplest demo is

package main
var f = func() int { return 1 }
var _ = f() + g()
var g = func() int { return 2 }
func main() {}

It is obviously legal, but it crashes. 

Remy, does your CL fix it?

I am torn about whether it should be in Go 1.1.1.
